title: uche6215
author: uche6215
content: With Donald trump being declared the winner of the just concluded united state of America presidential election and trump appointing Elon musk to his administration to a newly created department of government efficacy many people has been talking.So I was wondering what is the implications to the crypto family especially Bitcoin Let discuss get to learn from each other here?

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Not everything that goes on politically has an effect on Bitcoin. This is an issue that affects the American people and they will be eagerly watching how this new department performs. I hope it does not become just a publicity stunt with Musk posting about it regularly on X rather than actually fixing the areas that needs work in the government alongside Vivek.Quote from: uche6215 on November 15, 2024, 06:33:05 PMdepartment of government efficacy*efficiency.- Jay -

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Isn't it too early for us to start discussing a department that's yet to start fiction and its implications on cryptocurrency?  Aside from Elon being someone who has knowledge on cryptocurrency (major promoter for Dogecoin), I don't see anywhere that it's mentioned that the expected duty of the department is to be about cryptocurrency; their duty is to supercheck other agencies and make sure there is efficiency in their service and reduce or catch out the expensive spending that might have been going on in various departments in the government house.

If the price of Bitcoin is moving at its own pace then the true reflection is my belief that the price of Bitcoin will increase even more in the future.

comments.author: icalical
comments.body: While Musk has been pretty vocal about his thoughts on cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, on the other hand, Trump too historically is critical of Bitcoin, but he flips sides to support Bitcoin in his recent campaign and statement. If this administration goes in the direction of minimizing bureaucratic red tape and streamlining regulation, that might be a good thing for the crypto businesses, as it simplifies compliance issues and spurs innovation.On the other hand, however, this focus on efficiency could also mean that controls might get tighter. Past calls by Trump for increased oversight of digital assets in order to prevent misuse, and truly tech-driven approaches by Musk, may lead to more tightening, AI-powered monitoring of crypto transactions. While the crypto innovation might be lured by the deregulatory agenda, it might also mean more scrutiny or regulatory battles for the industry.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: As much as this is Political,  I think the takeaway from this is that in his personal capacity who recognizes cryptos this is a win as people will want to emulate what he does and will want to be aligned with what he does in trying to ride the wave of success.Otherwise his job has no direct bearing/influence on crypto  but it's good to know we have people of influence in high offices

While the crypto innovation might be lured by the deregulatory agenda, it might also mean more scrutiny or regulatory battles for the industry.If you are a citizen and doing right things, you don't have to worry about their monitor on your transactions. Your transactions are always public on Bitcoin Public Ledger, and you can practice carefully with your inputs, outputs, use Tor to secure your privacy and somewhat anonymity. Criminals will have more fear of more and tighter regulations and monitoring activities on their transactions that are used for something like money laundering.

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: Quote from: nelson4lov on November 15, 2024, 10:54:26 PMThat's a bold claim considering Bitcoin chart has been in a chop state prior to the election and this explosive moves we have had in the last 2-3 days were mainly due to Trump's win. Most people even forgot that we were in a bull market because of how much chop and huge red days we had along the way. In as much as i will say that I will agree that the win was actually an added catalyst which pumped the price I will say that the market was definitely on his way up. Bitcoin market was predicted to actually pump within this last quarter of the year and it was positioned for that when late October it broke that $70k price barrier and was actually going to break the then all time high ($74k) but was in a ranging movement which is the thing a price does before breaking any major resistance. The question is without the win will the market have still broken the mark, I say yes because regardless of anything bitcoin market always pumps in the last quarter of the halving year, but the election win added the hype to the win and made the win impulsive as we have today

comments.body: Quote from: uche6215 on November 15, 2024, 06:33:05 PMWith Donald trump being declared the winner of the just concluded united state of America presidential election and trump appointing Elon musk to his administration to a newly created department of government efficacy many people has been talking.So I was wondering what is the implications to the crypto family especially Bitcoin Let discuss get to learn from each other here?It's a mere political appointment, or did the appointment come with any bitcoin or cryptocurrency insignia?, if the answer is no, then it's just normal appointment as Donald Trump is trying to put his cabinet in place with the people he knows he can trust, which Elon musk has shown so far that he is a trusted ally.However, as for the crypto community, the signs are there already, it's visible to the blind and audible to deaf about the current affairs of bitcoin ever since Donald Trump was declared winners if the just concluded U.S election, the price of bitcoin has gone astronomically high even though Trump has not been sworn in yet, this goes to tell you that there are good times ahead.

comments.author: Swordsoffreedom
comments.body: Quote from: Spaceman1000$ on November 16, 2024, 01:07:05 PMHowever, as for the crypto community, the signs are there already, it's visible to the blind and audible to deaf about the current affairs of bitcoin ever since Donald Trump was declared winners if the just concluded U.S election, the price of bitcoin has gone astronomically high even though Trump has not been sworn in yet, this goes to tell you that there are good times ahead.I hope what you say happens because the only thing I care about when Trump gets elected is that he will be more open to crypto. But we need to know that he is not yet officially president and we still have no guarantee that he will keep his promises regarding cryptocurrencies. Therefore, we should not be too subjective or expect too much from a politician if we do not want to be too disappointed. There is no denying that his victory has had a positive impact on the markets but that is because the markets are putting their faith in him and still believe that he will treat us well. The recent market rally does not guarantee that he will keep his crypto-friendly promises.

comments.author: Ziskinberg
comments.body: This has nothing to do with Bitcoin yet. If it’s about efficiency, I think Elon might be starting to replace humans with robots for tasks, robots are more efficient and don’t need breaks. Add more cameras and advanced algorithms, and the U.S. could monitor everything effectively. With Elon involved, oversight and implementation could become smoother and more effective.As for Bitcoin, I wouldn’t expect Elon Musk to make any positive moves. He’s known for shilling meme coins, especially DOGE, so he’d likely just hype that even more. What I’m more curious about is Trump’s policy on Bitcoin. If there’s going to be a major impact, it’s Trump, not Elon, who could make it happen.
